article.title: Status of Alpha-Particle Condensate Structure of the Hoyle State

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the expectation value of the antisymmetrization operator (N(B)) indicate about the Hoyle state?
choices: The Hoyle state is a pure Slater determinant.
The Hoyle state is closer to a quartet condensation situation than the ground state.
The influence of antisymmetrization is stronger in the Hoyle state than in the ground state.
The optimal B value for the Hoyle state is smaller than the optimal B value for the ground state.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the α particle occupation numbers in Figure 2 reveal about the Hoyle state?
choices: The α particles in the Hoyle state are distributed evenly across different orbitals.
The Hoyle state exhibits a strong preference for α particles occupying D-orbitals.
Approximately 70% of the three α particles in the Hoyle state occupy the same OS orbital.
The ground state and the Hoyle state have similar α particle occupation number distributions.

multiple_choice_question.text: What significant difference is observed between the ground state and Hoyle state wave functions shown in Figure 3?
choices: The Hoyle state wave function exhibits pronounced oscillations due to strong α particle overlap.
The ground state wave function lacks any nodal behavior, resembling a broad Gaussian.
The Hoyle state wave function shows a more compact spatial structure compared to the ground state.
The ground state wave function exhibits a long tail extending to r ~ 10 fm, unlike the Hoyle state.

multiple_choice_question.text: What key difference in α particle localization is evident when comparing single Brink and THSR intrinsic densities for ⁸Be in Figure 4?
choices: The Brink density portrays α particles as localized and fixed in a dumbbell-like configuration.
The THSR density depicts α particles as fixed at the origin, resembling a compact molecular structure.
The Brink density exhibits a broader distribution of α particles compared to the THSR density.
Both densities demonstrate a similar degree of α particle localization, suggesting similar underlying physics.
